getDataRecord

IDataBrowserRecord getDataRecord(int rowIndex)
                                 throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
Returns the data browser record by means of the current row index.

Instead of IDataBrowser.getRecord(int) this method considers the current column order selected by the user, which might be different from the initial/default browser order as established by the database. This method should be used then implementing IBrowserEventHandler.filterCell(IClientContext, IBrowser, int, int, String) or IBrowserEventHandler.decorateCell(IClientContext, IBrowser, int, int, String) since the given row index is based on the current display order.

Parameters:
rowIndex - the row index of the record to get
Returns:
the desired data browser record
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if 0 <= rowIndex < IDataRecordSet.recordCount() is not fullfilled
Since:
2.7.2

getDefinition

IBrowserDefinition getDefinition()
Returns the underlying browser definition of this GUI browser.

Returns:
the browser definition

setSelectedRecordIndex

void setSelectedRecordIndex(IClientContext context,
                            int index)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
Select the hands over index in the current dataBrowser.
This enforce a propagateSelection on the DataBrowser.

The selection will be reset if you hands over -1>/code>

Parameters:
context - the current client context
index - The zero based index to select or -1 to unselect.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

expand

void expand(IClientContext context,
            IDataBrowserRecord record)
            throws java.lang.Exception
Expand the record in the browser. All children of the record are visible after this call.
The tree node will be refreshed if the node is already expanded.

Parameters:
context -
record -
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
Since:
2.7.4

expandAll

The tree node will be refreshed if the node is already expanded.

hasChildren

boolean hasChildren(IClientContext context,
                    IDataBrowserRecord record)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
Checks whether the given record has child records.

Note: This method might be used to set different icons in a tree browser by means of IBrowserEventHandler.decorateCell(IClientContext, IBrowser, int, int, IDataBrowserRecord, String) . Do not call IBrowserEventHandler.hasChildren(IClientContext, IBrowser, IDataBrowserRecord) directly, since this might be an expensive operation and has usually already been done by the underlying framework!

Parameters:
context -
record -
Returns:
true if child records are present, otherwise false
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
Since:
2.10

refresh

void refresh(IClientContext context,
             IDataTableRecord record)
             throws java.lang.Exception
Refresh the given record in the browser. Normally this will be done by the internal framework. The one and only reason to call this method manually is, that you change the parent/child relation in an ISelectionAction or a TableHook of more than one record.
This is a design fault at the moment.

Parameters:
context -
record -
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
Since:
2.7.4

refresh

void refresh(IClientContext context,
             IDataBrowserRecord record)
             throws java.lang.Exception
Refresh the parent to child position of the given record in the browser. Normally this will be done by the internal framework. The one and only reason to call this method manually is, that you change the parent/child relation in an ISelectionAction or a TableHook of more than one record.
This is a design fault at the moment.

Parameters:
context -
record -
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
Since:
2.7.4
